title: JavaexportsKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about JavaexportsKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Use
exports
in a module's
module-info.java
file:
module mymodule {
  exports com..package1;
  exports com..package2 to module1, module2;
}
Definition and Usage
The
exports
keyword allows a package from a module to be used by other modules.
If the
to
keyword is added, the exported package is only allowed to be used by the modules that are listed.
Note:
The
exports
keyword is a module directive meant to be used in the
module-info.java
file of a module.
The
exports
keyword was new in Java 9.

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers JavaexportsKeyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use JavaexportsKeyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of JavaexportsKeyword and how to apply it in your projects.
